messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] compassion for those with  A virus Q??
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra, This virus can wipe out your hard drive, especially if you use the d/m/y format according to Symantec. If you check the following link, it gives
messages.messageBody:
Sandra,
This virus can wipe out your hard drive, especially if you use the d/m/y
format
according to Symantec. If you check the following link, it gives further
information.
http://www.symantec.com/avcenter/venc/data/w32.sircam.worm@...
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: <SandraDodd@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 24, 2001 8:27 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] compassion for those with A virus Q??

messages.subject: compassion for those with  A virus Q??
messages.msgSnippet: This one isn t a hard-drive wiping-out virus.  A friend cleaned his out last night pretty easily.  I have the link to the cleanup instructions if anyone comes
messages.messageBody:
This one isn't a hard-drive wiping-out virus. A friend cleaned his out last
night pretty easily. I have the link to the cleanup instructions if anyone
comes to need it, but the virus will probably come from someone you know and
have a title of something you've corresponded about before (because it uses
old e-mail trails somehow), but the text will be this:

<< > Hi! How are you?
>
> I send you this file in order to have your advice
>
> See you later. Thanks >>

I wouldn't just delete it. I would tell them they have a virus. You can
respond to the e-mail without it hurting your computer. They won't know
unless someone who got the e-mail tells them.

Sandra



Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDodd
http://expage.com/RadicalUnschooling
